DOC.brief_summary: The study compare impact Child STEPs ( see Weisz et al. , 2012 ) versus usual school-based therapy student ' mental health school-related outcome , test whether change school outcomes mediate change student mental health .
DOC.brief_title: Student Outcomes Integrative Mental Health Services
DOC.detailed_description: This project implement evaluate Child STEPs ( see Weisz et al. , 2012 ) treatment approach randomize control trial ( RCT ) eight K-8 public school . The STEPs model two component : ( 1 ) modular protocol combine 33 modulesâ€”i.e. , description common element within evidence-based therapy anxiety , depression , post-traumatic stress , conduct problem ; ( 2 ) web-based system monitor student response treatment provide weekly feedback therapist , guide selection sequence STEPs module . The project include evaluation effectiveness STEPS compare `` treatment usual '' ( know Usual Care UC ) student ' mental health school-related outcome , analysis whether change school outcomes mediate change student mental health .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Enrolled grade 37 2 . Have primary clinical problem area anxiety , depression , conduct , posttraumatic stress 3 . Clinically elevate problem level Internalizing , Externalizing , AnxiousDepressed , WithdrawnDepressed , Aggressive Behavior , RuleBreaking Behavior scale Child Behavior Checklist Youth SelfReport UCLA Posttraumatic Stress Disorder Reaction Index 1 . Mental retardation 2 . Pervasive developmental disorder 3 . Eating disorder 4 . Children attention problem hyperactivity primary referral concern 5 . Active psychosis and/or suicide attempt previous year
